title: Scientifically Speaking with Irene Moon
description: Irene Moons first album from 1997 10 inch, repressed in 2004.  Self-release on Begonia Society.  Entomology lectures set to organ music.
label: Begonia Society

title: Floralaldehyde
description: Field Recordings of an Insect Biochemistry Laboratory created in Athens, GA with Thaddeus Koolhoeven founder of the Noisettes.  Moon played centrifuge and sonication devices with them for a short while. This is side A of the LP.  I have to find side B which is a live set using these sounds which included Robert Duckworth. Released sometime in 1998.
performers: Irene Moon, Thaddeus Koolhoeven, Robert Duckworth
label: Begonia Society

title: Grooming Casualties
description: Maybe earlier
label: Begonia Society

title: Suplico #3
description: GOT 012
label: Gods of Tundra

title: Grooming Casualties / phylum forver split
description: Irene Moon / fslux - Grooming Casualties / phylum forver        16 minute tape              limited to 30. Entomologist Irene Moon gives 8 minutes of plunderphonic insect inspired/utilized sound.  fslux gets the other 8 to provide her four-track gravel-sludge noise.  Comes in a deluxe plastic cassette box with original artwork from, and pictures of, both ladies. From the grel label in 2002.  You can find the fslux material on the grel site.
label: grel

title: Entomelodical Opportunities
description: Series of radio events with Irene Moon and various real guests including Robert Beatty (Hair Police, Three Legged Race) and Irene's father. Included in the theaterical stories are various characers from the Auk Theater all performed by Irene. These segments were from Irene's radio show on WRFL fm (88.1; Lexington Kentucky) or through podcast.
label: Begonia Society

title: For the Neonate
description: Irene Moon and Friends, 10 inch record. For the neonate was originally recorded in honor of the birth of Lovids first kid.  Sick Hour is Robert Beatty and Trevor Tramaine of the Hair Police and other fine bands. Artwork and larval centifold from the drawings of Brenden Lawson. Horror for the breakfast table. One odd collage. This album was made in 2004-5 sometime.
performers: Robert Beatty, Trevor Tramaine, Ergo Phizmiz, Irene Moon
label: Begonia Society

title: The Neithers
description: Split CS from about 2004 with Eyes and Arms of Smoke.  Recorded in Lexington Kentucky with Eyes and Arms of Smoke and the household of the Charles Mansion.  Sara Okeefe was the other main Auk on the Niethers.
performers: Irene Moon, Ellen Molle, Sara Okeefe, Trevor Tramaine, Robert Beatty
label: Begonia Society

title: Antenna Alley
FieldStation: Field Station G - Santa Barbara, California
description: An 11 episode series of short, absurd, yet factual insect-music adventures created by Irene Moon. Special guest artists from the world of noise and sound will contribute an extra buzz. Episodes start on January 15th, 2024 and will air exclusively on WFMU's Daniel Blumin Show every Monday between 9 PM to midnight EST. Contributing Artists/Special Guests are GX Jupitter-Larsen, Ian MacPhee, LoVid, Ironing, Ergo Phizmiz and Lottie Bowater, The Virus, Francisco López, Hearty White, Jana Winderen, Yon Visell, Wobbly, Matmos, Rrose, venoztks, People Like Us, Hearty White and Ed Sunspot.
performers: Irene Moon, GX Jupitter-Larsen, Ian MacPhee, LoVid, Ironing, Ergo Phizmiz and Lottie Bowater, The Virus, Francisco López, Hearty White, Jana Winderen, Yon Visell, Wobbly, Matmos, Rrose, venoztks, People Like Us, Hearty White and Ed Sunspot
label: WFMU
